div.l: They told euery man that he was wood
So he was agast of noes flood
Thorow fantesye that of hys vanyte
He hadde bought hym knedyng tubbis thre
And hadde hym hanged in the roof aboue
And that he prayde hem for goddys loue
To sittyn in the roof per companye
The folk gan lawghen at hys fantesye
In to the roof they kykyn and they gape
And turned al hys harm in to a Iape
For what so euer thys carpenter answerd
It was for nought noman hys reson herd
Wyth othys grete he was swore a doun
That he was holde wood in all the toun
For euery clerk right anon held wyth other
They said the man was wood my leue brother
And euery wyght gan lawghe at thys stryf
Thus swyuyd was the carpenters wyf
For al hys kepyng and al hys Ielousye
And absolon hath kyssed her nethyr eye
And Nycholas is scalded in the toute
This tale is doon and god saue al the route
Here endeth the Myllers tale
And here begynneth the reues prolog
WHan folk had lawghen at this nyce caas
Of Absolon and of hend Nycholas
Dyuerse folk dyuersly they sayden
But for the more part they lowhe ‚Åäand pleyden
Ne at thys tale I sawe noman hym greue
But yf it were only Oswold the reue
By cause he was of carpenteris craft
A lytyl Ire is in hys herte ther laft
He gan to grutche and blame it alyte
Sy the quod he ful wel I coude the quyte
With bleryng of a proud myllers eye
Yf that me lyst to speke of Rebaudrye
